ARABIC: لِتُنذِرَ قَوْمًا مَّآ أُنذِرَ ءَابَآؤُهُمْ فَهُمْ غَٰفِلُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: so that you may warn a people whose fathers were not warned and who are therefore unaware.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: That you may warn a people whose ancestors had never been warned, who are therefore heedless.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: so that you may warn a people whose ancestors were not warned before wherefore they are heedless.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: so that you may warn a people who are unaware because their fathers were not warned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So that you may warn these people whose ancestors were not warned, they are therefore unaware.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: In order that you may warn a people whose forefathers were not warned, so they are heedless.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: That you may warn a people whose fathers were not warned, so they are heedless.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: that thou mayest warn a people whose fathers were never warned, so they are heedless.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: That thou mayst warn a folk whose fathers were not warned, so they are heedless.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: so that you may warn a people whose fathers were not warned and so they are unaware.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: That thou mayest warn a people whose fathers were not warned; so they are negligent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: that you may warn a people whose fathers were not warned, so they are oblivious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: In order that thou mayest admonish a people, whose fathers had received no admonition, and who therefore remain heedless (of the Signs of Allah).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: In order that you may warn a people whose forefathers were not warned, so they are heedless.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: so that you may warn a people whose fathers were not warned, and so were heedless.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: To warn a people whose ancestors were not warned, and so they are unaware.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: That you may warn a people whose forefathers were not warned, so they are unaware.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [36:6] that you may warn, therewith, a people (qawman, connected to tanzīla, ‘a revelation’) whose fathers were not warned, in the period of the interval (al-fatra), so they, this people, are oblivious, to faith and right guidance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (That thou mayst warn) by means of the Qur'an (a folk) i.e. the Quraysh (whose fathers were not warned) by any messenger; it is also said that this means: that you may warn your folk as their fathers were warned, (so they are heedless) of the matter of the Hereafter, i.e. they are in denial of it. 496
